Hero.heading: Neurology With Personal Attention
Hero.description: Specialized care for headaches, dizziness, neuropathy and more. Private clinic in the heart of Vienna.

Emergency.P1: Private doctor, no public health insurance accepted
Emergency.P2: You can get a fast-appointment (Mon–Fri) after schedule reorganization
Emergency.P2Span: if one of the following conditions applies

Li.3: Acute sore throat or swelling in the neck and abnormal thyroid values

Emergency.P3Span: Please bring your current lab results from your family doctor (TSH, fT3, fT4, TPO-Ab, Tg-Ab, TRAb as well as a complete blood count)

0.address: Mariahilfer Straße 95/19, Staircase 1, 1060 Vienna (U3 Zieglergasse station)

Services.Heading: Services
Services.HeadingP: As a neurologist, I work with patients who suffer from conditions affecting the brain, spinal cord, nerves, and muscles. Many neurological problems begin with subtle signs such as numbness, headache, or persistent fatigue. My approach focuses on listening carefully, identifying the underlying neurological cause, and guiding each patient toward a clear diagnosis and effective treatment plan.

0.Title: Stroke
0.p: Sudden weakness, numbness, or difficulty speaking or seeing.

1.Title: Migraine
1.p: Recurrent one-sided headaches with nausea or light sensitivity.

2.Title: Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
2.p: Immune-mediated disease of the brain or spinal cord causing weakness or visual imbalance.

3.Title: Parkinson’s Disease
3.p: Tremor, slow movement, muscle stiffness, and balance issues.

4.Title: Epilepsy
4.p: Recurrent electrical discharges causing seizures or loss of consciousness.

5.Title: Peripheral Neuropathy
5.p: Numbness, tingling, or pain in hands or feet from nerve damage.

6.Title: Trigeminal Neuralgia
6.p: Brief but intense facial pain episodes.

7.Title: Myasthenia Gravis
7.p: Muscle weakness worsening with effort, improving with rest.

8.Title: Autonomic Disorders
8.p: Disturbance of blood pressure, heart rate, sweating, or digestion control.

0.Title: Anxiety Disorders
0.p: Persistent fear or tension with physical symptoms.

1.Title: Sleep Disorders
1.p: Difficulty falling or staying asleep due to neurological imbalance.

2.Title: Chronic Neuropathic Pain
2.p: Ongoing pain linked to altered nerve signal processing.

0.Title: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
0.p: Disabling tiredness not relieved by rest, often with cognitive and muscle symptoms.

1.Title: Post-COVID Syndrome
1.p: Fatigue, brain fog, and pain persisting after infection recovery.

0.Title: Chronic Neck Pain
0.p: Muscle tension or nerve compression in the cervical region.

1.Title: Sciatica
1.p: Pain radiating from lower back to leg due to nerve root pressure.

2.Title: Herniated Disc
2.p: Slipped disc pressing on spinal nerves causing pain or weakness.

0.Title: Tension Headache
0.p: Steady head pressure caused by muscle strain.

1.Title: Cluster Headache
1.p: Severe pain attacks on one side of the head or behind the eye.

2.Title: Facial Neuralgia
2.p: Nerve irritation in the face leading to sharp pain or spasm.

Telemedizin.Heading: Telemedicine
Telemedizin.p: Initial consultation and follow-up for therapy adjustment
Telemedizin.span: for patients who prefer video calls.
